Key Arguments: The proposed legislation undermines free speech, which is essential to democracy.
Misinformation and disinformation are prevalent from both public and government sources, and exempting government entities from the legislation is unacceptable.
Censorship will increase public distrust in the government.
Free speech allows for healthy discussion and personal discernment.
The bill is overreaching and potentially dangerous due to the abuse of power by the government.
The legislation does not align with Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
Notable Quotes: All censorship will do is breed greater distrust of our government by the people.
There is no place for government in dictating what we can and canâ€™t say, read, or believe.
This proposed bill in its current state does not conform with this article and is need of abolishment or major amendment.
